title: Clueless reboot TV series confirmed as mash-up of Riverdale and Lizzo video
text:
Truly, what is happening? (Picture: Paramount)

Have you ever sat down and thought ‘you know what the world needs? A mash-up of Clueless and Riverdale’?

Well, you are in luck.

A dramatic TV remake of the 1995 classic Clueless has been confirmed and we are equal parts baffled and rather angry.

CBS TV Studios owns the TV rights to the teen movie, having followed up the Alicia Silverstone film with a sitcom, created by the movie’s director Amy Heckerling and starring Rachel Blanchard alongside many of the film’s original stars, that lasted for three seasons.

What. A. Film (Picture: Elliott Marks/Paramount/Kobal/REX/Shutterstock)

But now, they’ve decided to reboot Clueless for a new generation with the same characters but a new cast – and according to Deadline, the reboot is described as ‘Mean Girls meets Riverdale meets a Lizzo video’.

The new series will focus on Dionne – who was played by Stacey Dash in the film and previous sitcom – after her bestie Cher Horowitz (originally played by Alicia Silverstone) mysteriously disappears.

While attempting to navigate being the newly most popular girl at a ‘uniquely 2020 LA’ high school, Dionne must also find out what’s happened to her friend.

The reboot will take cues from Riverdale (Picture: Netflix)

We are totally bugging.

Director and writer of Clueless Amy Heckeling is not involved, with Corinne Brinkerhodd, Tiffany Grant and original Clueless producer Robert Lawrence attached to the project, which is currently being shopped around Hollywood.

Unsurprisingly, the news that Clueless is being rebooted – with Deadline describing the concept as ‘baby pink and bisexual blue-tinted, tiny sunglasses-wearing, oat milk latté and Adderall-fueled’ – hasn’t delighted many Bettys or Baldwins.

Clueless – itself a modern day twist on Jane Austen’s Emma – is considered one of the best teen movies of all time, influencing fashion and slang after its release in 1995.

The film focuses on Cher, a rich, popular teenager who, alongside her best friend Dionne, makes over new girl Tai (Brittany Murphy), attempts to set up two of her teachers and battles with her feelings for her ex-stepbrother Josh (Paul Rudd).

Stacey Dash, Elisa Donovan (Amber) and Donald Faison (Murray) returned for the 1996 sitcom, although Rachel Blanchard played Cher Horowitz as Alicia Silverstone was not available.
